issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

components.name: webhdfs
components.description: WebHDFS: HTTP REST API for HDFS

fields.description: If you call {{getPos()}} on an {{FSDataOutputStream}} returned by {{WebHdfsFileSystem#append}}, it will initially return 0, even if the file already had content. This method should return the initial length of the file before appending.
fields.summary: WebHDFS append returned stream has incorrectly set position

comments.body: Attaching a patch with a unit test which demonstrates the issue

[~elgoiri] FYI cancelling Patch Available because what I have posted does not contain any sort of fix; it is just a unit test.

This ends up being kind of tricky. The position of the stream is not known until the DataNode is contacted and it performs {{DFSClient#append}}. In the current setup, the DataNode does not send a response until it is done writing the file... So I don't see a clean way for it to communicate an initial position back to the client.

[~xkrogen], I wanted to get the exception catch by Yetus for tracking.
Do you mind posting the log/failed condition?

The {{write()}} works correctly and appends to the end, right?
Making sure it's just an issue with {{getPos()}}.
Yup, it's just the {{getPos()}} that messes up. Data is still correctly appended to the end of the file (if you comment out the failing assert, the test succeeds).
